title: Rocketman reunion as Elton John hangs out with Taron Egerton on his birthday
text:
Rocketman reunion as Elton John hangs out with Taron Egerton (Picture: Taron Egerton / Elton John / Instagram)

Rocketman star Taron Egerton has reunited with Elton John to celebrate his 30th birthday.

Because who else would you want to party with, right?

The duo joined the likes of David Furnish and Brandi Carlile as they hung out backstage at a Joni Mitchell concert – and we’re not jealous at all.

Taking to Instagram, the actor documented his evening where he shared his appreciation for the legendary singer.

He wrote: ‘Tonight I saw @brandicarlile perform Joni Mitchell’s Blue. @eltonjohn and @davidfurnish took me for my birthday.

‘Like many others, I have a deeply profound connection to her music and it makes me feel a great deal when I hear it.

The trio were celebrating Taron’s birthday (Picture: Taron.Egerton / Instagram)

‘I’m not really sure how to convey quite what it is I feel, but I am yet to discover anything else that makes me feel that way.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The star added: ‘As Brandi said during her show: we don’t live in the age of Shakespeare or Rembrandt. But we do live in the age of Joni.

‘Tonight I met Joni. She is beautiful. I gave her a gift from Wales. It was one of the best things that has ever happened to me.

‘I then saw Brandi perform Blue in it’s entirety with an incredible group of musicians and it was just about the most wonderful thing I have ever seen.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Taron played Elton in the biopic Rocketman (Picture: Rex)

‘I found it very moving and I did not want it to end. My cells are still ringing and vibrating with beautiful words and breathtaking music and a voice that was equal to it.’

The birthday boy concluded: ‘I feel humbled and privileged and profoundly lucky. And a bit like I know myself a little better. Brandi, I am in awe of You. And Joni. And Blue.’

Sounds monumental.

In the comments, the Honky Cat hitmaker was quick to write: ‘@Taron.Egerton Love you,’ before his hubby David teased: ‘@Taron.Egerton Love you more’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Taron played Elton John in the recent biopic Rocketman, and the iconic duo have been BFFs ever since.

They’ve even teamed up once again for Elton’s new autobiography (out today), where the actor will be reading the audio book.

description: Rocketman reunion as Elton John hangs out with Taron Egerton on his birthday.
